purpose: JSON-LD schema for FastAPI machine-readable docs; downstream code-writing agent uses types, properties, and @id patterns to resolve symbols and cross-references.

Document.description: Root of one JSON-LD file (one per Python module)

ModuleInfo.description: In-document context so downstream agent can distinguish disambiguated filenames

Parameter.description: Parameter of a function or method

Decorator.description: Decorator (e.g. get, post) or dependency marker

ReExport.description: Symbol re-exported from this module (e.g. from .applications import FastAPI)

Import.description: Import from another module (for cross-file references)

role.description: Short role, e.g. routing, security, openapi

fastapiVersion.description: FastAPI version this doc was generated from

exports.description: List of Class, Function, Exception, Decorator, or ReExport

imports.description: List of Import for cross-file resolution

reExports.description: ReExport entries for public API surface

crossFileLinks.description: References use @id that can be resolved to another JSON-LD file by modulePath or outputFilename
rules: Class.bases may be @id to fastapi:class/... in same or other file
ReExport.sourceModule maps to module path; downstream agent resolves to outputFilename via moduleList
Import.module maps to module path for dependency graph

disambiguatedFilenames.description: When two modules would map to same filename, use suffix (e.g. fastapi-dependencies-models.jsonld); each file MUST include modulePath and outputFilename in Document so downstream agent can tell them apart
